cat_facts.fact: Cats have over 20 vocalizations, including the meow, purr, chirp, and trill. Interestingly, adult cats typically only meow to communicate with humans, not other cats.
A cat's nose print is unique, like a human's fingerprint. No two cats have the same nose print pattern.
Cats have 230 bones in their body, compared to 206 in humans. Many of these extra bones are in their spine and tail, giving them exceptional flexibility.
A cat's whiskers are roughly as wide as their body, helping them determine if they can fit through tight spaces.
Cats spend 70% of their lives sleeping, averaging 13-16 hours per day. This is an evolutionary adaptation from their wild ancestors who needed to conserve energy for hunting.
When a cat brings you a 'gift' like a dead mouse, they're trying to teach you to hunt because they see you as a poor hunter who needs help.
Cats can rotate their ears 180 degrees and can move each ear independently, allowing them to pinpoint the source of sounds precisely.
Cats were first domesticated around 10,000 years ago in the Near East, likely because they hunted mice attracted to stored grain.
In ancient Egypt, killing a cat, even accidentally, was punishable by death. When a family cat died, family members would shave their eyebrows in mourning.
The first cat show was held in London in 1871 at the Crystal Palace, organized by Harrison Weir.
Cats can jump up to six times their length and can run at speeds up to 30 miles per hour in short bursts.
A cat's hearing is about four times more sensitive than a human's, and they can hear ultrasonic sounds that are inaudible to humans.
Cats have a specialized collarbone that allows them to always land on their feet when falling. This is called the 'righting reflex' and develops around 3-4 weeks of age.
A group of cats is called a 'clowder,' while a group of kittens is called a 'kindle.'
The oldest known cat lived to be 38 years old. Her name was Creme Puff and she lived in Austin, Texas.
Cats cannot taste sweetness because they lack the taste receptor for it. This is likely because their carnivorous diet never required detecting sugars.
